page.title: 19St. Bede's School.
page.content: St. Bede's School is situated in a small village near Hailsham, just off the A23. It started about 9 years ago as a boy's School. It's grounds used to belong to a man called Horatio Bottomly who built quite a lot of the village. At present it is an international school with no class barrier. There are about 300 pupils, the majority of whom are boarders. The School owns about 45 acres of land which is divided into 3 main parts; the main grounds and dorms, the administrative block, eating, games and activity facilities. Away from the School is the Stud which is also a boy's house, together with girls' chalets. The Riding School also belongs to St. Bede's and riding activities are offered daily. Around the Stud are 3 large games pitches. Camberlot is also a boy's house.
